intro: Pappophorum lindleyanum var. glaucum, commonly known as the glaucous grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, hairy seeds enclosed in a pappus, which aids in wind dispersal. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is distinguished by its bluish-gray foliage, which gives it its common name.
